definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Cette corde est plus forte que l'autre.

thoughts: The adjective "strongest" is the superlative form of "strong" and it signifies the highest degree of strength. In the context of learning English, it is essential for beginners to understand the concept of superlatives, which are used to express the extreme or highest degree of a quality. This form is often used to compare multiple items or people, denoting one that has the most strength.

definitions.native: le plus fort, la plus forte, les plus forts, les plus fortes
definitions.note: Utilisé pour comparer trois éléments ou plus.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: He is the strongest person I know.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: C'est la personne la plus forte que je connaisse.

thoughts: The word 'structure' as a noun typically refers to the arrangement or organization of parts to form an object or system. It can also refer to a building or object that has been constructed. These meanings are common and relevant for beginners.

definitions.note: Peut se référer à l'organisation d'un système ainsi qu'à un édifice construit.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The structure of the building is very complex.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: La structure du bâtiment est très complexe.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour décrire la disposition ou l'arrangement d'un système ou d'une entité.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The structure of the company is hierarchical.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: L'organisation de l'entreprise est hiérarchique.

thoughts: Pour un débutant, il est important de comprendre que 'stuck' est généralement utilisé pour indiquer que quelque chose est fixé ou bloqué dans une position. Les exemples seraient pratiques pour voir le mot dans son utilisation contextuelle.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The door was stuck and wouldn't open.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: La porte était bloquée et ne s'ouvrait pas.

thoughts: The word 'stuck' as an adjective describes a situation where something cannot move, either physically or metaphorically. This is a common adjective used in everyday language and can be translated into French as "coincé".

definitions.note: Utilisé quand quelque chose ne peut pas bouger.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The car is stuck in the mud.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: La voiture est coincée dans la boue.

definitions.note: Souvent utilisé de manière figurée pour décrire une situation sans issue.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She felt stuck in her job and wanted a change.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle se sentait bloquée dans son travail et voulait du changement.

thoughts: The word "student" is a common English noun and is straightforward for beginners to learn. Its primary meaning pertains to a person who is studying at a school or other educational institution. In French, it translates to 'étudiant' for masculine or mixed-gender groups, and sometimes 'étudiante' for feminine. This is a relevant and important word for beginner learners, as education is often a common topic. We should provide examples that are easy to understand and relevant to typical school-related contexts encountered by students.

definitions.note: En français, 'étudiant' est utilisé pour les hommes ou de manière neutre, et 'étudiante' pour les femmes.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The student is studying for the exam.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: L'étudiant étudie pour l'examen.

thoughts: Students refers to individuals enrolled in a course of study, typically at a school, college, or university. It is the plural form of 'student,' which is why the examples provided will reference more than one student.

definitions.note: Dans un contexte universitaire, on utilise "étudiants", et dans un contexte scolaire (primaire/secondaire), on utilise "élèves".
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The students are preparing for their exams.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Les étudiants préparent leurs examens.

thoughts: The word 'studied' is the past tense and past participle of the verb 'study'. It typically means to spend time learning or investigating a subject carefully.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She studied all night for the exam.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle a étudié toute la nuit pour l'examen.

thoughts: The word "studies" in its noun form is the plural of "study," which refers to the act or process of learning about a subject, usually by reading and comprehensive interpretation, as in academic contexts. It can also refer to a particular instance or type of learning. Understanding this for a beginner would involve translating to the concept of learning or areas of learning in French, such as "études." This definition is especially relevant to academic and educational contexts, which are familiar to most learners. An example sentence would help contextualize its use as a noun.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She has completed her studies at the university.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle a terminé ses études à l'université.

thoughts: The word "studio" is a noun that generally refers to a room or space where an artist, photographer, or musician creates their work, or where television, radio, or film recordings take place. It can also refer to an apartment that combines bedroom, living room, and kitchenette into a single space ("studio apartment"), though in many contexts, especially where the living space meaning is more apparent, it is left as "studio". Since the learner is a beginner and the primary meaning of "studio" in English is similar to "atelier" or "studio" in French, I'll provide the basic artistic or creative space definition.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The artist painted a new masterpiece in her studio.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: L'artiste a peint un nouveau chef-d'œuvre dans son studio.

thoughts: The word "study" as a noun commonly refers to the act of learning or examining in depth. It can also mean a room specially designed for reading and studying. These are the primary meanings beginners are likely to encounter, as more complex or nuanced meanings might be confusing at this stage.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She spends a lot of time in study each evening.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle passe beaucoup de temps à étudier chaque soir.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: He works in his study at home every day.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Il travaille dans son bureau à la maison tous les jours.

thoughts: The word 'study' as a verb generally means to engage in learning or reviewing material, often in an academic context. This is a key concept for beginner learners and would be directly applicable to their learning process.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I need to study for my math test tomorrow.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Je dois étudier pour mon test de mathématiques demain.

thoughts: The word 'studying' is the present participle form of the verb 'study.' In this form, it is often used to describe an ongoing action of learning or examining something attentively. French learners will benefit most from understanding its basic sense of engaging in the activity of study.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She is studying for her exams all weekend.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle étudie pour ses examens tout le week-end.

thoughts: The word 'stuff' as a noun commonly refers to general things or materials that are not specified. It is often informal and can denote objects, substances, or even personal belongings. For French learners, it can be translated to words like 'choses', 'trucs', or 'affaires', depending on the context. It's important to provide a clear example sentence to show how it is used in everyday English.

definitions.note: Le mot est informel et souvent utilisé pour indiquer des choses non spécifiques.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I need to pack my stuff for the trip.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Je dois préparer mes affaires pour le voyage.

thoughts: Style, as a noun, generally refers to a particular way in which something is done, created, or expressed. It can relate to fashion, art, writing, or even broader concepts like lifestyle. Beginners may encounter it in contexts like clothing style or writing style.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She has a unique style of clothing.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle a un style vestimentaire unique.

definitions.note: Utilisé dans le sens de méthode ou particularité dans la manière de faire quelque chose.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: His style of writing is very engaging.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Sa façon d'écrire est très captivante.

thoughts: The word 'subconscious' as a noun refers to the part of the mind that is not fully aware but influences actions and feelings. It is not commonly used in everyday conversation, but it is important for understanding psychological discussions. Beginners might encounter it in discussions about mind and behavior.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: Dreams are often a way for our subconscious to communicate with us.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Les rêves sont souvent un moyen pour notre subconscient de communiquer avec nous.

thoughts: The word 'subject' as a noun often refers to the topic being discussed or the main focus of a conversation, lesson, or writing. It could also mean a person or thing that is being dealt with in a particular context. In an educational setting, a 'subject' typically means a specific area of study, like math or history, and this is a common way beginners might encounter the term. In grammar, 'subject' refers to the part of a sentence about which something is said. However, for beginner learners, focusing on the context of school subjects is most relevant.

definitions.note: Quand on parle de 'subject' dans un contexte scolaire, il s'agit des matières étudiées, comme les mathématiques ou l'histoire.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: My favorite subject in school is mathematics.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Ma matière préférée à l'école est les mathématiques.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour discuter du sujet d'une conversation ou d'un document.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The main subject of the book is environmental conservation.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le sujet principal du livre est la conservation de l'environnement.

thoughts: The word 'subjects' is the plural form of 'subject', and can have two primary meanings: (1) a topic under discussion or study, and (2) individuals who are under the authority or jurisdiction of a monarch, often referred to in the context of citizens or those being governed. The first meaning is most relevant to beginner learners, as it relates to school and academic subjects, which are very common contexts in learning English. We should focus on the educational meaning for this entry, as it is the most prevalent and useful for beginners.

definitions.note: Utilisé principalement dans le contexte de l'éducation ou de l'étude.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: We are studying different subjects at school this year.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Nous étudions différentes matières à l'école cette année.

thoughts: The word "sublime" as an adjective typically refers to something that is of such excellence, grandeur, or beauty as to inspire great admiration or awe. It is often used to describe things that are lofty or majestic, be it nature, art, or experiences. It conveys a sense of transcendence beyond the ordinary. In French, similar terms would be "sublime," "merveilleux," or "magnifique." These translations capture the emotional impact of something being extraordinarily impressive or remarkably beautiful. Beginner learners might encounter it in descriptions of nature, art, or profound experiences.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The view from the mountaintop was absolutely sublime.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: La vue du sommet de la montagne était absolument sublime.

thoughts:
The word 'submarine' refers to a type of underwater vehicle, typically military. It is commonly understood as a noun with no significant ambiguity or different meanings for a beginner learner context.

In French, the translation is "sous-marin." This translation is direct as both languages share a similar term due to the Latin root "sub" for "under" and "marine" pertaining to the sea.

An example sentence for a beginner English learner might describe the basic function of a submarine in a simple context.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The submarine can travel underwater for long periods.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le sous-marin peut voyager sous l'eau pendant de longues périodes.

thoughts: The word "subtle" is an adjective that generally means something that is not immediately obvious or noticeable, often requiring keen perception or attention to detail to recognize. In French, it would be translated as "subtil." Beginner learners would benefit from understanding its usage to describe things that are delicate or nuanced. We should provide an example sentence that illustrates its meaning in context.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The perfume has a subtle scent that is not overpowering.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le parfum a un parfum subtil qui n'est pas écrasant.

thoughts: The word 'subway' refers to an underground railway used for public transportation, predominantly found in cities. A beginner learner might benefit from understanding this basic and widely used term, as it relates to travel and urban navigation.

definitions.note: Le mot 'subway' est principalement utilisé en Amérique du Nord pour décrire le métro.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I take the subway to work every morning.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Je prends le métro pour aller au travail tous les matins.

thoughts: The word 'succeed' is a verb meaning to achieve the desired aim or result. This is a common verb that beginner learners might encounter when talking about goals, achievements, and outcomes. It's important to note that 'succeed' typically refers to achieving a positive result, rather than just any result. The example sentence should reflect a common situation of success that a learner might relate to, such as passing an exam or completing a task.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She worked hard to succeed in her exams.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle a travaillé dur pour réussir ses examens.

thoughts: The word "succeeded" is the past tense of the verb "succeed." This implies it is used to indicate a completed action in the past. The verb "succeed" typically means to accomplish a goal or achieve success in an endeavor. This is a common usage and straightforward definition relevant to beginner learners.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She succeeded in finishing her project on time.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle a réussi à terminer son projet à temps.

thoughts: Success as a noun typically refers to the accomplishment of a goal or the attainment of wealth, recognition, or other favorable outcomes. It's a common word for English learners and relates to personal achievements or positive results.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She achieved great success in her career.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle a obtenu un grand succès dans sa carrière.

thoughts: The word 'successful' is an adjective that is used to describe someone or something that has achieved a desired outcome or goal. In French, it is often translated as 'réussi' or 'qui a du succès'. This usage can apply to people, events, or projects. Beginners should understand this as describing the positive outcome or accomplishment.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She is a successful businesswoman.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle est une femme d'affaires réussie.

thoughts: The word 'such' as an adjective can be translated as 'tel', 'pareil', or 'si' in French, depending on the context. It is used to describe something that is like or similar to what has been mentioned. It can also emphasize the extent or degree of something, often paired with words like 'a' or 'an.' Since it emphasizes qualities or quantities already mentioned, understanding its use can help beginners grasp nuances in descriptions.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour donner un exemple ou pour exprimer une similitude avec ce qui vient d'être mentionné.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She had never seen such beauty before.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle n'avait jamais vu une telle beauté auparavant.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour insister sur un degré important ou extrême de quelque chose.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: It was such a long journey.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: C'était un voyage si long.

thoughts: The determiner 'such' is used to indicate a type or degree, often to emphasize something. It can be translated to "tel", "tellement", or "si" in French depending on its usage, and often combines with nouns in its structure.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour donner de l'emphase.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: It was such a beautiful day.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: C'était une si belle journée.

thoughts: The word "sudden" is used as an adjective to describe something happening quickly and unexpectedly. It's a useful word for beginner learners as it's often used in everyday speech to describe abrupt changes or events. The French equivalent is "soudain." In French, adjectives generally agree in gender and number with the nouns they modify, but this is not a concern when translating this single English word. Providing an example sentence can help learners see how "sudden" is applied in context.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The weather change was so sudden.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le changement de temps était si soudain.

thoughts: The word 'sudden' is typically an adjective, meaning 'something happening quickly and unexpectedly.' However, in some constructions, it might appear to function adverbially, especially as part of the expression 'all of a sudden', which means 'suddenly' or 'without warning.' This usage would be more accurately represented by another lexical item ‘suddenly’ in conventional grammar. For simplicity and precision, I'll treat it as an adjective for this beginner's learning context.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The car came to a sudden stop.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: La voiture s'est arrêtée brusquement.

thoughts: The word "suddenly" is an adverb and is used to describe actions or events happening quickly and unexpectedly. In French, it is commonly translated as "soudainement" or "tout à coup." Beginner learners will benefit from understanding how it is used in sentences to express abrupt or unexpected changes.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She suddenly decided to leave the party.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle a soudainement décidé de quitter la fête.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: Suddenly, the lights went out.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Subitement, les lumières se sont éteintes.

thoughts: The word 'sugar' as a noun primarily refers to a sweet, crystalline substance obtained from various plants, primarily sugar cane and sugar beets, which is used to sweeten food and drinks. It's a common concept and often one of the first words learned due to its everyday use. For beginner French learners, focusing on its primary use as an ingredient or flavoring is most appropriate.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I like to put sugar in my coffee.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: J'aime mettre du sucre dans mon café.

thoughts: The verb 'suggest' refers primarily to putting forward an idea or a plan for consideration by others. It can also mean to propose or recommend something, often as a solution or course of action. These meanings would be relevant to a beginner English learner since 'suggest' is commonly used in both casual and formal communication.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I suggest that we leave early to avoid traffic.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Je suggère que nous partions tôt pour éviter le trafic.

thoughts: The word "suggested" is the past tense and past participle form of the verb "suggest". It means to propose an idea or a course of action. This is a common verb used in everyday conversation when someone is offering a recommendation or advice.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She suggested that we meet at the park.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle a suggéré que nous nous rencontrions au parc.

thoughts: Let's consider the word "suggestion" which is a noun. In English, it usually refers to an idea or proposal put forward to consider or discuss. In French, the translation is "suggestion", and this is a direct translation that's commonly used. For beginner learners, understanding this basic meaning is crucial. Let's include a straightforward example sentence to illustrate its use.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She made a suggestion to improve the project.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle a fait une suggestion pour améliorer le projet.

thoughts: The word 'suggestions' is the plural form of the noun 'suggestion'. It refers to ideas or plans that are proposed or put forward for consideration. Beginner English learners would likely need simple definitions and clear example sentences.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: He gave me some good suggestions for my presentation.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Il m'a donné de bonnes suggestions pour ma présentation.

thoughts: The word 'suit' as a noun commonly refers to a set of garments made of the same fabric, typically a jacket and trousers or a skirt, worn for formal occasions. It can also refer to a lawsuit, but for beginners, the clothing meaning is more common and relevant.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: He wore a suit to the interview.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Il portait un costume pour l'entretien.

thoughts: The verb 'suit' generally means to be appropriate or convenient for a particular situation, person, or purpose. In French, this can be translated as "convenir" or even "aller" depending on the context. An example could illustrate the use of 'suit' to denote something that is appropriate, like a meeting time or living arrangement.

definitions.note: Le verbe 'suit' signifie être approprié ou convenable dans une certaine situation.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: Does this time suit you for the meeting?
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Est-ce que cet horaire te convient pour la réunion ?

thoughts: The word 'suitable' is an adjective that describes something as being appropriate or fitting for a particular purpose or situation.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: This dress is suitable for the party.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Cette robe est appropriée pour la fête.

thoughts: The word 'suitcase' is a common English noun referring to a piece of luggage used for carrying clothes and other personal items when traveling. In French, the translation is "valise."

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I packed my suitcase for the weekend trip.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: J'ai fait ma valise pour le voyage du week-end.

thoughts: The word "suitcases" is the plural form of "suitcase," which means it refers to more than one suitcase. A suitcase is a common item used for packing clothes and personal items for travel. Understanding "suitcases" would involve recognizing them as luggage or bags used for trips, a practical concept familiar to most learners.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I have packed my suitcases for the trip.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: J'ai fait mes valises pour le voyage.

thoughts: The word "suits" as a noun refers to two primary meanings: formal clothing typically of a matching jacket and trousers or a card suit in a deck of playing cards. However, for a beginner English learner, the most relevant definition would be the clothing meaning, as it's more commonly encountered in everyday contexts.

definitions.note: "Suits" ici est utilisé pour désigner un ensemble vestimentaire formel ou professionnel souvent porté lors des occasions importantes ou dans des environnements de travail.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: He always wears suits to the office.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Il porte toujours des costumes au bureau.

thoughts: The word "suits" as a verb is the third person singular form of "suit". It typically means to be appropriate or acceptable for someone or something. This form is used in sentences like "That shirt suits him well." A beginner learner would benefit from understanding that it implies suitability or appropriateness. The example sentences should reflect this use.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: This color suits you perfectly.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Cette couleur te convient parfaitement.

thoughts: The word 'sum' as a noun refers to the total amount resulting from the addition of two or more numbers, items, or amounts. It is a fundamental term in arithmetic and can be easily understood as the result of addition. Beginner learners are likely to encounter this word in contexts related to mathematics or when adding anything in everyday life.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The sum of 5 and 10 is 15.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: La somme de 5 et 10 est 15.

thoughts: The word 'summer' is a noun that refers to the warmest season of the year, occurring between spring and autumn. It is a common word with direct translation and doesn't have any confusing or rare meanings that would be relevant to beginner learners. Hence, it's appropriate to focus on the basic, commonly understood definition.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: We always go on vacation during the summer.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Nous partons toujours en vacances pendant l'été.

thoughts: The word "sun" is a noun and primarily refers to the star at the center of the solar system or, by extension, sunlight. This definition should be clear for beginner learners and is likely the primary focus for them. There are no obvious rare or confusing secondary meanings in this context.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The sun rises in the east.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le soleil se lève à l'est.

thoughts: The word 'sunset' is a noun that refers to the time in the evening when the sun disappears below the horizon. It is commonly associated with the end of the day and often evokes imagery of beautiful, colorful skies. French learners would likely translate this to "coucher de soleil." The concept is simple and universal, making it a suitable entry for beginner learners.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: We watched the sunset from the beach.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Nous avons regardé le coucher de soleil depuis la plage.

thoughts: The word 'super' is often used as a slang for something very good or excellent. It's commonly found in both English and French with a similar meaning.

definitions.note: Utilisé comme un mot d'argot pour décrire quelque chose de très bien ou excellent.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: That movie was super!
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Ce film était super !

thoughts: The word 'superb' is an adjective used to describe something as being of high quality or excellence. It can be translated as 'superbe' in French and is used in similar contexts in both languages. Beginner English learners will find this word useful for expressing praise or admiration.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The concert last night was superb.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le concert d'hier soir était superbe.

thoughts: The word 'superhero' is a common noun in English referring to fictional characters who have extraordinary powers and often fight against evil. This term is widely used in popular culture, particularly in comic books, movies, and TV shows. In French, the direct translation is "super-héros," which maintains the same concept.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: Spider-Man is a famous superhero known for his web-slinging abilities.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Spider-Man est un super-héros célèbre connu pour ses capacités à tisser des toiles.

thoughts: The word "supermarket" is a common noun in English, used to refer to a large store offering a wide variety of food and household goods organized into aisles. In French, this is translated as "supermarché." Beginners learning English should understand this word as it is related to everyday life where shopping commonly takes place.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I bought some fresh vegetables at the supermarket.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: J'ai acheté des légumes frais au supermarché.

thoughts: In this context, "supply" as a noun generally refers to the provision or stock of resources or goods. It can be translated into French as "approvisionnement" or "fourniture." This concept is often used in contexts regarding commerce, economics, or resource management.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The hospital needs a constant supply of medical equipment.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: L'hôpital a besoin d'un approvisionnement constant en matériel médical.

thoughts: "Support" en tant que nom peut se traduire par "soutien", "aide" ou "support" en français. Pour un apprenant débutant, il est important de se concentrer sur les sens les plus communs de "support" en tant que nom, et fournir un exemple clair dans chaque langue, en montrant comment le mot est utilisé dans une phrase. Par exemple, cela peut inclure le soutien émotionnel ou pratique donné à quelqu'un. Ces significations seront aidantes pour communiquer des concepts fréquents et utiles dans les interactions quotidiennes.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She gives us a lot of support during difficult times.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle nous apporte beaucoup de soutien pendant les moments difficiles.

definitions.note: En français, "support" peut aussi s'utiliser dans le sens de tenir quelque chose en place dans un contexte technique ou matériel.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The shelf needs more support in the middle.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: L'étagère a besoin de plus de support au milieu.

thoughts: The verb 'support' generally means to help or assist, particularly in a way that provides encouragement or reinforcement.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I will support you in your decision.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Je vais te soutenir dans ta décision.

thoughts: The word "supporting" is used as the present participle of the verb "support." This form often indicates a continuous or ongoing action of providing help or assistance. In French, the verb "supporter" shares a similar meaning, so the translation directly aligns, making it relatively straightforward for beginners. Example sentences will illustrate its use in context.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour décrire l'action continue d'offrir de l'aide ou du soutien.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She is supporting her friend during difficult times.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle soutient son amie pendant les moments difficiles.

thoughts: "Suppose" is a verb used to express an assumption or a guess based on evidence or reasoning. In French, it is often translated as "supposer." It's commonly used in everyday speech to express hypothetical scenarios or to introduce an assumption that will later be discussed.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I suppose we should leave early to avoid traffic.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Je suppose que nous devrions partir tôt pour éviter le trafic.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour donner un exemple hypothétique.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: Suppose you had a million dollars, what would you do?
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Imagine que tu aies un million de dollars, que ferais-tu ?

thoughts: The word "supposed" is the past tense of the verb "suppose." It's commonly used to describe a situation where something was expected or assumed. This can also sometimes imply a sense of obligation or duty in certain contexts, as in "I was supposed to help." It's important for beginner learners to understand the basic past tense and expectation/assumption usage.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour indiquer ce qui était prévu ou attendu.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I was supposed to meet her at 5 PM.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: J'étais supposé la rencontrer à 17h.

thoughts: The word 'supreme' is an adjective that means the highest in rank or authority, the utmost, or the ultimate. It can describe something that is the best or of the highest quality, which is a concept that might be relevant for beginner learners in contexts such as describing the quality of a meal, a court, or a position of power.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The Supreme Court is the highest court in the country.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: La Cour suprême est la plus haute juridiction du pays.

definitions.note: Souvent utilisé pour exprimer quelque chose de la meilleure qualité possible.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: This restaurant is known for its supreme quality of food.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Ce restaurant est connu pour la qualité suprême de sa nourriture.

thoughts: The word 'sure' as an adjective generally means certain or confident. It is often used to express a strong belief or conviction about something or to express agreement. In French, it would typically translate to 'sûr' for certainty or 'certain' depending on context, but in agreement, it could translate to 'bien sûr'. Since 'sure' can be used to confirm or agree upon something in conversation ('sure' as an affirmation), it can also translate as 'bien sûr'. I'll choose a simple example sentence demonstrating its most common usage as an adjective reflecting certainty or assurance.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I am sure that I locked the door.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Je suis sûr d'avoir verrouillé la porte.

thoughts: The word 'sure' as an adverb is used to express certainty or agreement. It's a common term that beginners in English should learn because they will frequently encounter it in conversations and informal speech. In French, this translates to "certainement" or "bien sûr". With this in mind, let's create a dictionary entry for 'sure' as an adverb.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: You can sure count on him to finish the project on time.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Tu peux certainement compter sur lui pour finir le projet à temps.

thoughts: As an interjection, "sure" is often used to express agreement or assurance in informal settings. In French, this might be translated to expressions like "bien sûr" or "d'accord," depending on the context. The nuance and tone of the interjection can vary slightly, but generally conveys a positive or affirming response.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour exprimer l'accord ou l'assurance dans un contexte informel.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: — Want to join us for dinner? — Sure!
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: — Tu veux te joindre à nous pour le dîner ? — Bien sûr !

thoughts: "Surely" is an adverb used to express certainty or confidence about something in English. In French, this is generally translated as "sûrement" or "certainement." It's commonly used in situations where the speaker is affirming something or when expecting agreement. The example sentence should reflect typical usage where the speaker expresses this confidence.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: Surely, you can understand why this is important.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Sûrement, tu peux comprendre pourquoi c'est important.

thoughts: "Surface" as a noun has several common meanings in English. It often refers to the outermost layer or top part of an object, like a table's surface, or the Earth's surface. It can also refer to the appearance of something, suggesting a superficial or external aspect. In French, 'surface' is translated similarly, often used in physical or abstract contexts. Beginners might encounter both the literal and metaphorical uses, so providing examples in both contexts could be helpful.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The surface of the table was smooth and shiny.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: La surface de la table était lisse et brillante.

definitions.note: Souvent utilisé pour décrire l'apparence extérieure ou une première impression.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: Everything seemed fine on the surface, but there were underlying issues.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Tout semblait bien en surface, mais il y avait des problèmes sous-jacents.

thoughts: Here, the word 'surgeon' refers to a medical professional specialized in surgery. It's important for learners to know that this term is specific to someone who performs operations.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The surgeon performed a complicated operation.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le chirurgien a réalisé une opération compliquée.

thoughts: "Surgery" is a noun that refers to the medical procedure that involves treating injuries or disorders of the body by incision or manipulation, especially with instruments. This concept might be quite specific for beginner learners, but it's an important word that could be encountered in contexts regarding health, hospitals, or medical discussions.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She is recovering well after the surgery.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle se rétablit bien après la chirurgie.

thoughts: The word "surprise" as a noun is commonly used in English to refer to an unexpected event or something that unexpectedly occurs. It can be both positive or negative. For beginner French learners, understanding this concept with simple examples will help them recognize and use the noun correctly in English. The most relevant French translation is "surprise."

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The party was a complete surprise to her.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: La fête était une véritable surprise pour elle.

thoughts: The word 'surprise' as a verb in English typically means to cause someone to feel astonishment or shock by doing something unexpected. For beginner learners, it would be beneficial to provide a simple example of a situation where someone is surprised, with a direct translation in French. The key translation here is "surprendre."

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The magician surprised everyone with his new trick.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le magicien a surpris tout le monde avec son nouveau tour.

thoughts: The word 'surprised' is the past participle of the verb 'surprise'. It is often used as an adjective to describe someone's feeling. It generally means that someone did not expect something. Beginner learners will likely find it helpful to see an example of how 'surprised' is used in a sentence to understand its usage in context.

definitions.note: Utilisé souvent comme adjectif pour exprimer une émotion inattendue.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She was surprised to see him at the party.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle était surprise de le voir à la fête.

thoughts: The word "surprised" as an adjective refers to a feeling or reaction someone has when something happens that they did not expect. This is a fundamental concept in both English and French, as it's common to describe emotions and reactions. In French, the equivalent is "surpris(e)", depending on the gender of the subject.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour décrire une émotion inattendue.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She was surprised by the news.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle était surprise par la nouvelle.

thoughts: When thinking about the word "surprises" as a noun, it refers to unexpected events or occurrences. In French, this translates to "surprises" as well. A beginner would likely benefit from understanding this word in the context of unexpected, often pleasant events. The example sentence should illustrate the plural form directly.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The party was full of surprises.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: La fête était pleine de surprises.

thoughts: The word 'surprises' is the third person singular present form of the verb 'to surprise'. In French, the verb is 'surprendre' and it carries the meaning of causing an unexpected or astonished reaction. This form is used when speaking about a third person who performs the action in a habitual or general sense. An example sentence could clarify its usage.

definitions.note: Troisième personne singulier du présent.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: He surprises everyone with his magic tricks.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Il surprend tout le monde avec ses tours de magie.

thoughts: The word "surprising" is an adjective used to describe something that is unexpected or causes surprise. Beginner English learners would benefit from having both the definition and example sentences to understand the context in which this adjective is used.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The results of the experiment were surprising.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Les résultats de l'expérience étaient surprenants.

thoughts: The word 'surrounded' is the past participle form of the verb 'surround'. This typically implies that something is enclosed or encircled by something else either physically or metaphorically. The primary translation will be 'entouré' in French. Beginner learners would benefit from seeing how to use this word in sentences to describe being physically surrounded by people or objects.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour décrire quelque chose qui est entouré physiquement ou métaphoriquement.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The house was surrounded by tall trees.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: La maison était entourée de grands arbres.

thoughts: The word 'surveillance' is a noun that refers to the act of closely observing or monitoring someone or something, often for security purposes. Given its French origin, the word carries a similar meaning in both English and French. For beginner learners, it is straightforward as it describes the concept of monitoring or watching, which is relevant in contexts like security, law enforcement, or technology.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour décrire la surveillance ou la supervision, souvent dans un contexte de sécurité.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The government increased surveillance after the incident for public safety.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le gouvernement a renforcé la surveillance après l'incident pour la sécurité publique.

thoughts: The word 'survival' is a noun that refers to the act or fact of continuing to live or exist, especially in difficult conditions. This concept is commonly used in contexts like wildlife, natural disasters, or any challenging situations impacting living beings. It's a straightforward term with a close French equivalent, making it relatively accessible for beginner learners to understand and use in sentences.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour décrire le fait de continuer à exister malgré des conditions difficiles.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The survival of the species depends on the preservation of its habitat.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: La survie de l'espèce dépend de la préservation de son habitat.

thoughts: The verb 'survive' is commonly used to mean continuing to live or exist, especially in spite of danger or hardship. This is a basic concept that beginner learners can find useful, as it can be applied to many contexts. The primary meaning of 'survive' is to outlive or withstand difficult conditions. Let's provide a definition and a clear example sentence that demonstrate this meaning.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: Many plants can survive in harsh conditions.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: De nombreuses plantes peuvent survivre dans des conditions difficiles.

thoughts: The word 'survived' is the past tense of the verb 'survive', which means to continue to live or exist, especially in spite of danger or hardship. It is a common verb often used in contexts related to overcoming difficult situations or outlasting others. For beginner learners, we should focus on the primary meaning related to enduring or staying alive after a challenging event.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She survived the storm last night.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle a survécu à la tempête la nuit dernière.

thoughts: The word "survivors" is the plural form of "survivor" and refers to individuals who have survived a difficult situation, such as a disaster, accident, or challenging circumstances. It's important to provide an example that shows this context clearly. The French equivalent is "survivants."

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The survivors of the earthquake were taken to a safe shelter.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Les survivants du tremblement de terre ont été conduits dans un abri sûr.

thoughts: "Suspected" is the past tense and past participle form of the verb "suspect," which means to believe something is true, particularly regarding something negative or criminal, without having definite proof. It is used in contexts where there is uncertainty or lack of concrete evidence, but there is a reason to believe something might be true. It implies a degree of doubt and is often used in legal or investigatory contexts. For a beginner learner, it is important to show how this word is used in sentences where a suspicion or an assumption has been made in the past.

definitions.note: Utilisé quand on croit que quelqu'un a fait quelque chose de mal ou d'illégal, sans preuve certaine.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The police suspected him of the crime, but they had no evidence.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: La police le soupçonnait du crime, mais elle n'avait aucune preuve.

thoughts: "Suspects" is the third person singular form of the verb "suspect." In this form, the subject is a singular noun or pronoun, such as "he," "she," or "it." It is used to express that someone believes something might be true or is suspicious of something. Beginners learning English should understand its usage in present tense to talk about current belief or suspicion.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: He suspects that she is lying.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Il soupçonne qu'elle ment.

thoughts: The word 'suspended' is the past participle form of the verb 'suspend'. This form is used primarily in passive voice constructions or perfect tenses. The basic meaning involves halting, delaying, or hanging something. Given that it's a common and straightforward term, I'll focus on its most typical uses: stopping temporarily (like suspending an activity) or hanging something up (like suspending a fixture).

definitions.note: Utilisé pour indiquer qu'une action ou un processus est temporairement arrêté.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The project was suspended due to unforeseen circumstances.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le projet a été suspendu en raison de circonstances imprévues.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour décrire quelque chose attaché ou accroché en l'air.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The lights were suspended from the ceiling.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Les lumières étaient suspendues au plafond.

thoughts: The word 'swallow' as a verb typically refers to the act of causing or allowing something (usually food or liquid) to pass through the throat from the mouth into the stomach. It's a basic action related to eating or drinking, which is a fundamental concept for beginner learners to grasp.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She had to swallow the big pill with water.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle devait avaler le gros comprimé avec de l'eau.

thoughts: The word 'swallowed' is the past tense of the verb 'swallow'. It means to cause or allow something to pass from the mouth into the stomach, generally referring to eating or drinking.

definitions.note: Correspond au passé du verbe 'swallow', signifiant 'avaler'.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She swallowed the medicine quickly.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle a avalé le médicament rapidement.

thoughts: The word "swear" is a verb with two main uses. One is to make a vow or promise and the other is to use offensive language. These are distinctly different meanings, so I will provide separate definitions for each. Both meanings might be relevant to beginner English learners due to their common usage in everyday language.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I swear to tell the truth.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Je jure de dire la vérité.

definitions.note: Lorsqu'il est utilisé de cette manière, ce verbe désigne le fait d'utiliser des mots impolis ou offensants.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: He started to swear when he hit his toe.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Il a commencé à jurer quand il s'est cogné l'orteil.

thoughts: The word "sweater" refers to a piece of clothing typically worn to keep warm. It's a common item in English-speaking countries, especially in cooler climates, and is a relatable concept for French speakers.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She wore a red sweater to the party.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle portait un pull rouge à la fête.

thoughts: The word 'sweating' is the present participle of the verb 'sweat', and it indicates the process of perspiring. For French beginners, the main translation would be 'transpirer', since it's the common way to refer to sweating in French. An example sentence will help illustrate how to use it in context.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: He is sweating a lot because it is very hot today.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Il transpire beaucoup parce qu'il fait très chaud aujourd'hui.

thoughts: The word 'sweet' as an adjective is commonly used to describe either a pleasant taste similar to sugar or to describe something as kind or pleasant. Both meanings are frequently encountered by beginner learners, so two definitions should be given.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour décrire une saveur agréable ou sucrée.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The cake was very sweet.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le gâteau était très sucré.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour décrire une personne ou une chose plaisante.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She gave me a sweet smile.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle m'a fait un doux sourire.

thoughts: The word "sweetheart" is typically used as a term of endearment to refer to someone you love, like a romantic partner. It can also be used affectionately towards someone you care about, such as a child or dear friend. In translating to French, "chéri/e" is commonly used for both romantic and affectionate contexts. While a learner may not be familiar with nuances of using terms of endearment in English, "sweetheart" usually carries a positive, loving connotation.

definitions.note: "Sweetheart" est souvent utilisé comme un terme affectueux pour un partenaire romantique ou quelqu'un cher.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: He bought flowers for his sweetheart.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Il a acheté des fleurs pour son chéri/sa chérie.

thoughts: The word 'sweetie' is primarily used as an affectionate term for a loved one, similar to 'honey' or 'darling'. It is often used in familial or romantic contexts. Learners should be aware of its informal and affectionate connotations. It's important to note that the translation to French, 'chéri(e)', may vary in form depending on the gender of the person being addressed.

definitions.note: C'est un terme affectueux utilisé pour s'adresser à un être cher.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: Goodnight, sweetie!
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Bonne nuit, chéri!

thoughts: Given the word 'swim', this is a basic verb that refers to moving through water by making motions with the arms and legs. The most relevant context for a beginner learner may involve recreational swimming or swimming in a pool or natural body of water. In French, this translates to 'nager,' which captures the direct action of swimming without additional meanings. For a beginner, it's vital to stick to this primary definition since 'swim' as a verb doesn't have drastically different meanings in normal, everyday contexts other than the physical activity itself.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She can swim very fast.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle peut nager très vite.

thoughts: The verb "swimming" is the present participle of "swim" and it refers specifically to the action of moving through water by using the limbs. It is often used in contexts related to water sports or leisurely activities in water.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour décrire l'action de nager, souvent dans un contexte sportif ou de loisir.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: Swimming is a great way to stay fit.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Nager est un excellent moyen de rester en forme.

thoughts: The word 'swimming' as a noun refers to the activity or sport of moving through water using one's limbs. In French, this would be translated to 'natation'. It is often associated with recreation, sport, or exercise. An example sentence can demonstrate its use in a simple and relatable way.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: Swimming is a great way to stay fit.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: La natation est un excellent moyen de rester en forme.

thoughts: The word 'switch' as a noun generally refers to a device that can stop or start an electrical circuit or change the flow of electricity from one path to another in a circuit. It can also refer to a change from one thing to another. These meanings are both simple and relevant for beginner English learners.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: He flicked the switch to turn on the lights.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Il a activé l'interrupteur pour allumer les lumières.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour parler du fait de remplacer ou échanger une chose pour une autre.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: There has been a switch in the meeting location.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Il y a eu un changement de lieu pour la réunion.

thoughts: The word "sword" is a noun referring to a type of weapon. It is a long, edged piece of metal used historically by soldiers and warriors in combat. In French, this translates to "épée." This word may appear in contexts related to historical warfare, fantasy genres, or collectibles, but is straightforward for beginner English learners.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour désigner une arme tranchante et longue utilisée dans les batailles historiques.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The knight drew his sword to defend the castle.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le chevalier a dégainé son épée pour défendre le château.

thoughts: The word 'swords' is a plural noun referring to a type of weapon with a long metal blade used for fighting. Its French translation is 'épées'. This is the primary meaning, and suitable example sentences in both English and French will help beginner learners grasp its usage.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The knights were equipped with swords and shields.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Les chevaliers étaient équipés d'épées et de boucliers.

thoughts:
The word "swore" is the simple past tense of the verb "swear." In English, "swear" can mean to make a serious promise or oath, or to use offensive language. We need to consider which of these meanings would be most relevant and straightforward for beginner learners.

The past tense form "swore" makes the primary sense for "swear"—making a solemn promise—likely more relevant. Swearing in the sense of using offensive language is a secondary nuance and might not be the primary focus for beginners. Therefore, we should focus on the meaning related to making a promise or oath.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: He swore he would never lie again.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Il a juré qu'il ne mentirait plus jamais.

thoughts: The word 'symbol' is a noun that is commonly used in English to represent something, often an idea, concept, or identity. In French, the equivalent word is also 'symbole.' This word's primary use is in contexts where abstract or real-world objects are used to signify something else, often as a part of culture, language, or mathematics. It's important in many discussions of semiotics, literature, and art.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour représenter une idée ou un concept avec un objet ou un signe.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The heart is a popular symbol of love.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le cœur est un symbole populaire de l'amour.

thoughts: The word 'symbols' is the plural form of 'symbol' and typically refers to multiple icons, signs, or marks that represent an idea, object, or relationship. In French, the word 'symboles' is used in a similar way to describe these representations. It's important to provide examples that relate to common uses of 'symbols', such as in mathematical contexts or as icons in daily life, as this would align well with the beginner learning focus.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The math book is full of symbols.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le livre de maths est plein de symboles.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: Road signs are important symbols for drivers.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Les panneaux routiers sont des symboles importants pour les conducteurs.

thoughts: The word 'system' is a noun and generally refers to a set of connected parts that function together. In French, it is translated as "système." It does not have multiple meanings at the beginner level, so only one definition is needed.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The solar system consists of the sun and eight planets.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le système solaire se compose du soleil et de huit planètes.

thoughts: The word "systems" is the plural form of the noun "system." A system typically refers to a set of things working together as parts of a mechanism or an interconnecting network. It can also mean a set of principles or procedures according to which something is done. In French, the translation is typically "systèmes." It is a common term used in various contexts, such as computer systems, biological systems, or organizational systems.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: Many computer systems need regular updates to function properly.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: De nombreux systèmes informatiques nécessitent des mises à jour régulières pour fonctionner correctement.

thoughts: The word 't' as a noun is not recognized as a standard English word. It's possible it could refer to something very specific, perhaps a term in a technical field, a shorthand or abbreviation, or simply a typographical error for a different word (like 'tea', 'tee', or 'T-shirt'). However, without additional context or a recognized usage, there's no standard definition to provide to a beginner English learner. It might be an error or non-standard usage that isn't useful to include in a basic dictionary.

The word "tab" is a noun, generally referring to either a small piece of material attached to something for identification or control, or to a bill or record of items purchased. These are the most common uses in everyday English and are relevant for learners.

1. ["onglet"] - This is used for tabs in the context of web browsing or indexing.
2. ["crémaillère"] - Could be used in very specific contexts, such as hanging curtains.
3. ["note"] - Used for notes or records of transactions.

It is important to showcase the usage of 'tab' in sentences to solidify understanding, especially considering these nuances in meaning.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I have too many tabs open in my web browser.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: J'ai trop d'onglets ouverts dans mon navigateur web.

definitions.note: S'emploie pour désigner une note ou un reçu d'achat.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: Let me pay the tab for dinner tonight.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Laisse-moi payer l'addition pour le dîner ce soir.

thoughts: The word "table" as a noun usually refers to a piece of furniture consisting of a flat slab supported by one or more legs. It can also refer to a chart in which data is arranged in rows and columns. Since the morphological information specifies the noun form, and taking into account that beginners might find both meanings relevant, it is reasonable to include both definitions.

definitions.note: meuble avec une surface horizontale sur laquelle on peut poser des objets.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The book is on the table.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le livre est sur la table.

definitions.note: un diagramme ou un graphique avec des informations.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: Please refer to the table on page 10 for more details.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Veuillez vous référer au tableau à la page 10 pour plus de détails.

thoughts: "Tables" is the plural form of the noun "table." A table is a piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs, providing a level surface for eating, writing, or working. It's a straightforward term, ideal for beginner learners, as tables are commonly found objects in everyday life.

definitions.note: Il s'agit du pluriel du mot "table", une surface plane soutenue par des pieds utilisée pour diverses activités.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The dining room has two tables.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: La salle à manger a deux tables.

thoughts: The word "tail" as a noun primarily refers to the extended part of an animal's body, usually at the back end. For beginners, it's important to focus on this common usage.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The dog wagged its tail happily.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le chien remuait joyeusement la queue.

thoughts: As a noun, 'take' can refer to a viewpoint, opinion, or interpretation on a particular matter, idea, or topic.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour indiquer comment quelqu'un perçoit ou interprète quelque chose.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: In my take, the movie was fantastic.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: À mon avis, le film était fantastique.

thoughts: "Take" est ici la forme de base du verbe anglais très courant qui correspond le plus souvent au verbe français « prendre ». Pour un apprenant débutant, le sens principal à retenir est l’action de saisir ou d’utiliser quelque chose (objet, moyen de transport, etc.). Le verbe a beaucoup d’autres emplois, mais les plus fréquents se recouvrent largement sous cette idée générale.

definitions.note: Verbe très courant ; sens général de saisir, obtenir ou utiliser quelque chose.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I always take the bus to work.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Je prends toujours le bus pour aller au travail.

thoughts: The word 'taken' is the past participle of the verb 'take'. In French, it would be translated as 'pris'. It's often used in perfect tenses or passive voice structures. For beginner English learners, understanding its use in these contexts is important. In this definition, I will provide an example of 'taken' in a sentence to illustrate its use as a past participle.

definitions.note: En tant que participe passé de 'take'.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The book was taken from the library.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le livre a été pris de la bibliothèque.

thoughts: "Takeoff" as a noun could refer to the act of a plane leaving the ground, or to an increase in activity or popularity.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The plane's takeoff was smooth and on time.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le décollage de l'avion était fluide et à l'heure.

definitions.note: "Takeoff" peut être utilisé au sens figuré pour décrire une augmentation rapide ou une montée en puissance d'une activité ou tendance.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The company's takeoff in the market surprised everyone.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: L'essor de l'entreprise sur le marché a surpris tout le monde.

thoughts: The word "takes" is the third person singular form of the verb "take." This verb generally means to acquire or receive something, or to move something from one place to another. It is commonly used and essential for beginner learners to know. In French, it translates to "prendre."

definitions.note: Forme verbale pour la troisième personne du singulier au présent.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She takes the bus to work every day.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle prend le bus pour aller au travail tous les jours.

thoughts: The word 'taking' is a form of the verb 'take', specifically the present participle or gerund form. It is often used to describe the action of someone or something in the process of taking, to indicate ongoing action. In French, this translates to 'prendre'. In English, this form is used in continuous tenses or as a gerund (a noun-like verb form).

definitions.note: Utilisé souvent pour indiquer une action en cours au présent.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She is taking her dog for a walk.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle promène son chien.

thoughts: The word 'tale' is a noun referring to a fictitious or true story, especially one that is imaginatively recounted. It's often used in contexts like fairy tales or stories of adventures. This is relevant for a beginner learner as it often appears in simplified reading materials or discussions about stories.

definitions.note: Utilisé souvent pour désigner une histoire fictive ou imaginative.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She told me a tale about a brave knight.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle m'a raconté une histoire sur un chevalier courageux.

thoughts: The word 'talent' is a noun with the same essential meaning in both languages: a natural ability or skill. This makes it fairly straightforward to translate, and it's a term often used in discussions about personal abilities, job qualifications, or someone excelling in a particular area. It's a common enough word that beginner learners may encounter it, especially in contexts like school or sports.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She has a talent for playing the piano.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle a un talent pour jouer du piano.

thoughts: The word 'talented' is used to describe someone who has a natural ability to do something well. This is an adjective, so it typically comes before a noun. In French, this can be translated as 'talentueux' or 'doué', both of which convey the idea of having talent.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She is a talented musician.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle est une musicienne talentueuse.

thoughts: The word "talk" used as a noun typically refers to spoken communication or a conversation. It's important to convey this basic meaning to beginners. However, "talk" can also mean a lecture or formal speech, which could be relevant for beginners in an educational context.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: We need to have a talk about your performance.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Nous devons avoir une discussion à propos de ta performance.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The professor gave an interesting talk on climate change.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le professeur a donné un discours intéressant sur le changement climatique.

thoughts: Un seul sens principal pour un débutant : « parler, discuter ». Possible petite note sur l’usage (informel, suivi de to/with). Exemple phrase au présent de base form.

definitions.note: Verbe plutôt informel ; on l’emploie souvent avec to/with pour indiquer la personne à qui l’on parle.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I need to talk to you about the project.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: J'ai besoin de te parler du projet.

thoughts: The word 'talked' is the simple past tense of the verb 'talk,' which means to speak or to converse with someone. Beginner learners will benefit from a clear sentence demonstrating past conversation, which should be simple and relevant to daily situations.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour indiquer une action de dialogue terminée dans le passé.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: Yesterday, we talked about the movie.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Hier, nous avons parlé du film.

thoughts: The word "talking" is the present participle of the verb "talk." It is commonly used to describe the act of having a conversation or discussing something. The French equivalent "parler" is similarly used in various contexts. For beginners, it's important to focus on its conversational usage.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She is talking to her friend on the phone.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle parle à son amie au téléphone.

thoughts: The word "talks" is a form of the verb "talk". As a verb, it describes the act of speaking or having a conversation. Considering an English app for beginners whose native language is French, it's relevant to focus on the basic verb meaning related to speaking or having discussions. Any nuances beyond the basic use of the verb can be complex for beginners, therefore, keeping it straightforward is ideal. We provide an example sentence to show its usage in context.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She talks with her friends every day.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle parle avec ses amis tous les jours.

thoughts: "Tall" is an adjective used to describe someone or something that has greater than average height. This word is commonly used to describe people, buildings, or objects such as trees or towers. In French, it translates to "grand" or "haut," depending on the context. Beginners should note that "grand" can also mean "big" depending on the context, which might lead to some confusion. The example sentence chosen illustrates the common use of "tall" to describe a person's height.

definitions.note: "Grand" est utilisé pour les personnes ou les objets, tandis que "haut" est souvent utilisé pour les objets non vivants.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She is very tall for her age.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle est très grande pour son âge.

thoughts: "Taller" is the comparative form of the adjective "tall," which means having more height than someone or something else. In French, the word would be translated to "plus grand" or "plus grand(e)", depending on the context. For beginner learners, it's important to convey that "taller" is used when comparing the height of two individuals or objects. This word is straightforward and doesn’t require additional notes beyond the basic translation and example sentences.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: He is taller than his brother.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Il est plus grand que son frère.

thoughts: The word "tape," as a noun, commonly refers to a long, thin piece of material used for binding, fastening, or measuring, such as adhesive tape, measuring tape, or videotape. In French, "tape" can be translated as "ruban" for general usage or "bande" for refereeing to video or audio tapes. For beginner learners, it's essential to provide simple examples that illustrate these common uses.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She wrapped the gift with tape.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle a emballé le cadeau avec du ruban adhésif.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: He watched an old movie on tape.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Il a regardé un vieux film sur bande vidéo.

thoughts: The word 'tapes' here is referring to the plural form of the noun 'tape,' which can describe adhesive tape or magnetic tape. For a beginner English learner, it's important to focus on the common meaning of adhesive tape. The example sentence should illustrate the usage of 'tapes' in a simple and understandable way, in a context that makes sense for daily life or basic learning scenarios.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I bought two rolls of tapes to wrap the gifts.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: J'ai acheté deux rouleaux de rubans adhésifs pour emballer les cadeaux.

thoughts: The word 'target' as a noun most commonly refers to an object or objective that is aimed at or intended to be reached. It could be something literal, like a mark to hit, or more abstract, like a goal to achieve. The beginner learner would benefit from understanding the basic, most commonly used meanings of 'target'.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The archer aimed carefully at the target.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: L'archer a visé soigneusement la cible.

definitions.note: "Objectif" et "but" sont utilisés de manière interchangeable dans le contexte d'un but à atteindre.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: Our target is to finish the project by the end of the month.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Notre objectif est de terminer le projet d'ici la fin du mois.

thoughts: The word 'task' as a noun generally refers to a piece of work or activity that needs to be done or undertaken. This concept often translates to French as 'tâche.' It's important for learners to understand that it is generally used in a professional, educational, or domestic context to describe specific assignments or duties. An appropriate example sentence would help illustrate its use in context, reinforcing its meaning for beginner learners.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I have a task to complete by the end of the day.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: J'ai une tâche à terminer d'ici la fin de la journée.

thoughts: The word "taste" as a noun refers to the sense by which flavors are perceived, a person's preference or liking for certain kinds of food or other experiences, or an individual's judgment or discernment in aesthetic matters. For beginners, the most straightforward definition is related to flavors, which will be important in everyday conversations.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour parler de la perception de saveurs.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I love the taste of chocolate.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: J'adore le goût du chocolat.

definitions.note: Parle des préférences personnelles, en particulier en matière de nourriture ou de style.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She has a taste for adventure.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle a un goût pour l'aventure.

thoughts: The word 'taste' as a verb involves the sense of tasting or trying food or drinks to understand their flavor. It is an important verb for beginner learners to understand because it's practical in many everyday situations.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: I like to taste new foods when I travel.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: J'aime goûter de nouveaux aliments quand je voyage.

thoughts: The word 'tastes' as a verb refers to the action of perceiving the flavor of something through the sense of taste. It is important to provide an example that clearly illustrates this sense of perception and to capture the connotation of experiencing or sampling a flavor.

definitions.note: Utilisé pour décrire l'action de percevoir le goût d'un aliment.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: He always tastes the soup before serving it.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Il goûte toujours la soupe avant de la servir.

thoughts: The word "tasty" is an adjective used to describe food that has a pleasant and enjoyable flavor. It's a common word in English and would be useful for beginner learners to know when discussing food preferences.

definitions.note: Utilisé principalement pour décrire la nourriture ou les boissons qui ont bon goût.
definitions.example_sentence_target_language: The cake was very tasty.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Le gâteau était très savoureux.

thoughts: "Tattoo" is best translated into French as "tatouage." The word has a specific meaning that is widely understood and used similarly in both English and French. This entry is straightforward, with no need for additional notes on usage.

definitions.example_sentence_target_language: She got a tattoo on her arm.
definitions.example_sentence_native_language: Elle s'est fait faire un tatouage sur le bras.

thoughts: The word "taught" is the past simple and past participle form of the verb "teach." It is used to describe the action of teaching that has already been completed in the past.
